title: Drawing, "Design for the Lower Portion of a Wall Panel", 1714
medium: Pen and black and sepia ink, brush and wash, black chalk on paper
provenance: Léon  Decloux, Sèvres,  France, in collection in 1906.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Three panels of architectural decoration, upper panel showing lower left of frame with claw foot; lower left with floral design around central framed oval; middle panel empty.  Dotted line with arrow at bottom runs down right edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for the Lower Portion of a Wall Panel", 1714.
1714. Pen and black and sepia ink, brush and wash, black chalk on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-232.
